tool.name: SAGA.shapes_lines.4
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayLINES False output_data_OUTPUT $output_data_OUTPUT name SAGA.shapes_lines.4 LINES $LINES TOLERANCE $TOLERANCE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.outputType_OUTPUT transmissionMode_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.transmissionMode_OUTPUT

param.name: LINES
param.label: Lines
param.help: Line or polygon shapefile to simplify. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: TOLERANCE
param.label: Tolerance
param.help: Maximum deviation allowed between original and simplified curve [map units].

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTPUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

param.name: outputType_OUTPUT
param.label: Simplified Lines
param.help: If not set points will be removed from the input data set.

tool.help: Line simplification implementing the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm.<br/><br/>Refererences:<br/>- Ramer, U. (1972): An iterative procedure for the polygonal approximation of plane curves. Computer Graphics and Image Processing, 1(3), 244-256<br/>- Douglas, D., Peucker, T. (1973): Algorithms for the reduction of the number of points required to represent a digitized line or its caricature. The Canadian Cartographer 10(2), 112-122<br/><br/>- Polyline Reduction source code at <a target="_blank" href="http://mappinghacks.com/code/PolyLineReduction/">mappinghacks.com</a><br/>
